```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r}
# Function to calculate put option payoff
put_payoff <- function(stock_price, strike_price, premium) {
  payoff <- ifelse(stock_price < strike_price,
    strike_price - stock_price, 0
  ) - premium
  return(payoff)
}

# Define stock price range and strike price
stock_price <- seq(40, 160, by = 1) # Stock price range
strike_price <- 80 # Strike price

# Calculate put option payoffs for different premiums
premiums <- c(0, 5, 10) # Premiums
payoffs <- sapply(
  premiums,
  function(p) put_payoff(stock_price, strike_price, p)
)

# Create data frame for plotting
df <- data.frame(
  stock_price = rep(stock_price, length(premiums)),
  Payoff = c(payoffs),
  Premium = factor(rep(premiums, each = length(stock_price)))
)

# Plot put option payoff profile
ggplot(df, aes(x = stock_price, y = Payoff, color = Premium)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(x = "Stock Price", y = "Payoff", color = "Option Premium") +
  theme_minimal() +
  ggtitle("Put Option Payoff Profile at Strike Price of $80")
```
